creator.name: Koloniale Raad Suriname
creator.his_func: The Colonial Council was established in 1833 and added to the Governor-General as an advisory body to assist in the administration of the colony of Suriname. It consisted of the Attorney General, the Administrator of finances and six of the most distinguished residents, being partially landowners residing in the colony and partially representatives of absentee landowners. The Council was chaired by the Governor-General and assisted by the Government secretary.
